Package upei.project

Class BFS

java.lang.Object
upei.project.BFS
Direct Known Subclasses:
BFSStrategy
class BFS extends Object
Searches to check if there is a valid path to a winning state for the current player

  • Constructor Details

    • BFS

      protected BFS(Board board, Fence potentialFence)
      Constructor checks for a valid path for the current player, switches player and then checks for currentOpp. boolean solution's value represents whether the fence placement willl be valid or not.

      Parameters:
      board - running instance of the game board
      potentialFence - fence that the player is trying to place

  • Method Details

    • solve

      private static boolean solve(Board board, Fence potentialFence)
      Places potential fence on board copy, and checks for a path to win.

      Parameters:
      board - copy of running instance of the game board
      potentialFence - fence that the player is trying to place
      Returns:
      true/false for valid placement/invalid placement respectively

    • findPath

      protected static int[] findPath(Board board)
      Uses BFS to find a path to winning state and returns the next move from current state for path to win.

      Parameters:
      board - copy of running instance of the game board
      Returns:
      move/null for valid placement/invalid placement respectively

    • getValidNeighbours

      private static ArrayList<int[]> getValidNeighbours(Board board, boolean[][] explored)
      Gets all valid children from current state

      Parameters:
      board - copy of running instance of the game board
      explored - boolean Board.SIZExBoard.SIZE array of explored states
      Returns:
      list of potential moves from current player's position

    • getMove

      private static int[] getMove(BFSNode node)
      Back tracks to root state through parents and returns the first move for the shortest path to win

      Parameters:
      node - winning state node
      Returns:
      move to make for shortest path to win
